intro: Asteromoea simplex, commonly known as the simple asteromoea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a clustered inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
